intro: Azorella elegans, commonly known as the elegant azorella, is a perennial shrub native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically basal, forming a rosette and are covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Azorella elegans is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
